alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 5:29AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Laurel, northeastern Pulaski, southwestern Jackson and central Rockcastle Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 529 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bobtown, or 9 miles north of Somerset, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Valley Oak, Bandy, Shopville and Bee Lick around 535 AM EDT. Level Green, Willailla and Quail around 540 AM EDT. Hansford, Bloss, Sand Springs, Wabp, Bromo, Spiro and Maretburg around 545 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Luner, Pongo, Wellhope, Burr, Billows, Sand Hill, Pine Hill, Flat Rock, Dudley Station, Orlando, Gauley, Camp Wildcat, Hazel Patch, Sinks, Jep Hill, Withers, Donaro, Wood Creek Lake, Robinet, Hare, Templer, Cruise, Mershons, Lamero, Eberle, Carico, Horse Lick, Ardery, Victory, Dango, Parrot, Peoples, Middlefork, Greenmount and Atlanta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
